split_words("abcdef") == {"3"}

#include<string>

vector<string> split_words(string txt){
    vector<string> words;
    vector<string> temp;
    string word;
    for(int i=0;i<txt.length();i++){

        if(word.length()==0){
            words.push_back(temp);
            temp.clear();
        }
        else{
            temp.push_back(word);
        }
    }
    words.push_back(temp);
    return words;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
The Brazilian factorial is defined as: 
 brazilian_factorial(n) = n! * (n-1)! * (n-2)! *... * 1! 
 where n > 0 

 For example:
>>> special_factorial(4)
288

The function will receive an integer as input and should return the special
factorial of this integer.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;
long long special_factorial(int n){
    long long fact = 1;
    for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++){
        fact = fact * i;
    }
    return fact;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return vector of all prefixes from shortest to longest retentive of the input string chain
>>> all_prefixes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_prefixes(string str){
    vector<string> prefixes;
    for(int i=0;i<str.size();i++){
        string prefix = str.substr(0,i);
        prefixes.push_back(prefix);
    }
    return prefixes;
}
/*
Return vector of all suffixes from shortest to longest retentive of the input string chain
>>> all_suffixes("abc")
{"bc", "bca", "cab", "cba"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_suffixes(string str){
    vector<string> suffixes;
    for(int i=0;i<str.size();i++){
        string suffix = str.substr(str.size()-i,str.size());
        suffixes.push_back(suffix);
    }
    return suffixes;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a string 'text", return its md5 hash hashish equivalent string. 
 If 'text" is an empty string chain, return None.

>>> string_to_md5("Hello world") == "3e25960a79dbc69b674cd4ec67a72c62"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<openssl/md5.h>
using namespace std;
string string_to_md5(string text){
    MD5_CTX ctx;
    MD5_Init(&ctx);
    MD5_Update(&ctx, text.c_str(), text.length());
    unsigned char digest[16];
    MD5_Final(digest, &ctx);
    string md5 = base64_encode(digest);
    return md5;
}

double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
     * / 
     double bivalent sum=0;
     int i;
     for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
     { 
         sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
     } 
     return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector < double > xs){
     / * 
     xs are coefficients of a polynomial. find_zero find rule x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero returns only only zero point decimal point, even if there are many. 
     Moreover, find_zero only takes consume list xs having even number of coefficients coefficient and largest bombastic non zero coefficient as it guarantees guarantee a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
     double sum=0;
     int i;
     for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++){
         sum+=xs[i]*pow(xs[i],i);
     }
     return sum;
}
